title: Ronald Pimentel
text:
Ronald Alexander Pimentel (born September 17, 1985 in <a href="Sonsonate%2C%20El%20Salvador">Sonsonate</a>) is a professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Club career.
Pimentel started his career at <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Salvadore%C3%B1o">Salvadoran Second Division</a> side <a href="Once%20Municipal">Once Municipal</a> in 2000, clinching promotion with them to the top tier and winning the <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Profesional%20Apertura%202006">Apertura 2006</a> tournament.
In 2007, he left them for <a href="C.D.%20Chalatenango">Chalatenango</a>, only to join <a href="Alianza%20F.C.">Alianza</a> a year later. After a year at <a href="C.D.%20Luis%20%C3%81ngel%20Firpo">Luis Ángel Firpo</a> in 2010, he rejoined <a href="Once%20Municipal">Once Municipal</a> for the Clausura 2011 season.
International career.
Pimentel made his debut for <a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador</a> in a November 2006 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="Panama%20national%20football%20team">Panama</a>. He has not played any international matches since.
